Concerts

Death Cab for Cutie Ticketing Information

Tickets will be on sale at 9 am, Monday September 29th at the Norris Box Office. Tickets will be $15 each, and students may buy 4 tickets per Wildcard. Limit 1 Wildcard per person. Transportation to and from the Riviera Theatre is included in the price of the tickets; transportation information to follow shortly. Cash, credit or debit is accepted, but there will be a cash-only table to move the process along as quickly as possible.

A&O Productions Fall Show: Death Cab for Cutie

A&O is proud to announce our fall blowout show, Death Cab for Cutie with special guest So Many Dynamos. The show will be October 10th at the Riviera Theatre in Downtown Chicago. Tickets will go on sale September 29th, for $15 at the Norris Box office. Transportation by bus is included in the price of tickets. Students will be able to buy 4 tickets per Wildcard, one Wildcard per person. A&O Productions would also like to remind students that we reserve the right to check Wildcards at the door of the show to ensure that all attendees are in fact Northwestern Students. Watch this space for more details closer to the sale date and show.

One Voice and A&O Productions present: Stars and French Horn Rebellion

One Voice is a Northwestern University student initiative that aims to speak for the millions of voiceless victims who are taken advantage of and sold into forms of modern-day slavery. Working with A&O Productions, they are presenting a free benefit concert on the Norris East Lawn on April 20th featuring Stars and former Northwestern band The French Horn Rebellion. The show starts at 3. In addition to the show there will be popcorn and other assorted snacks, face painting and finger painting.

Counting Crows bus information

There will be two pickup locations at SPAC, and on Emerson near Cahn. The first busses will leave at 5:50, the next sets at 6:15, 6:45, and finally 7:10. The first busses will be there in time for doors opening so attendees can reserve good standing space. The last busses will arrive in time for the opening band. Over 1,500 students have bought tickets, but tickets are still available at the Riviera box office!

Still time to buy Counting Crows tickets!

Over 1,100 Northwestern students this Thursday are going to see the Counting Crows. They are the number 1 band in the country right now!

What are you waiting for?

Tickets will be available at the Rock 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tuesday and Thursday and at Norris Box Office 10:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. They’re $15 for undergraduates and $30 for alumni, faculty, and staff. (Please present your WildCARD when purchasing tickets.)

Counting Crows tickets still available

As of noon on Thursday, April 3, tickets for Counting Crows are still available. See details below.

UPDATE: By the end of ticket sales Thursday, just under 1,000 tickets have been sold. Get your tickets while they’re still available!

BUS INFORMATION: There will be two pickup locations at SPAC, and on Emerson near Cahn. The first busses will leave at 5:50, the next sets at 6:15, 6:45, and finally 7:10. The first busses will be there in time for doors opening so attendees can reserve good standing space. The last busses will arrive in time for the opening band.

A&O Ball: Counting Crows at Riviera with Wild Sweet Orange

Tickets go on sale Thursday, April 3rd for A&O Ball featuring Counting Crows with special guest Wild Sweet Orange on Thursday, April 10th. Doors open at 6:30pm.

$15 a ticket includes transportation to the Riviera. Check back here or our Facebook event as we approach the night of the show for details.

Two tickets per Wildcard. One Wildcard per person

THE SHOW IS 18+. But any student who is not 18 and would like to attend should email AOBall.Crows@gmail.com

Thursday and Friday sales will be for undergraduate students only. If tickets remain, starting Saturday tickets will also be available to Northwestern alumni, staff, faculty, and graduate students for $30.

Girl Talk Tickets Sold Out

As of 12:20 pm, all tickets to the January 25th Girl Talk show have been sold out.  Lines formed outside the Norris Box office well before the 10 am availability, and sold out in less than 2 and a half hours.  Congratulations to those who were able to get one, it should be a great show.

Girl Talk Coming to Northwestern January 25th

Girl Talk, aka Gregg Gillis, will be performing January 25th in the Louis room at Norris.  Tickets will go on sale Wednesday, January 9th at 10 a.m. and will be $5 each, with a limit of two per Wildcard. Check out the video after the break for a small taste.

 

Only 100 Tickets for Ok Go & Ben Kweller Left at Box Office!

 If you plan on purchasing tickets for Ok Go & Ben Kweller before the show, you need to quickly get to Norris before 3pm today.  A&O will be providing more tickets at the door; but if you want to buy ahead of time and ensure you have a ticket, then go to the Box Office.  Remember: you can purchase up to 4 tickets per Wildcard (at the box office only), and all of A&O’s revenue will be donated to Dance Marathon’s charity Bear Necessities, which is a national organization whose mission is to eliminate pediatric cancer and to provide hope and support to those who are touched by it. bearnecessities.org
